com.nextlabs.nxl

Class RightsManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nextlabs.nxl.RightsManager

  • public class RightsManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains methods to encrypt an unprotected file, to decrypt an NXL file and to read or update the metadata of an encrypted NXL file. Only one instance of this class should be created by the calling application as creating an instance of this class is an expensive and time consuming task. The calling application can perform multiple encryption/decryption operations on the same instance. Even in multithreaded scenarios, create a single instance of RightsManager and share it among different threads. This class is implicitly thread safe (as a consequence of Immutability) but method(s) receiving mutable parameters may not be in some scenarios.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RightsManager(java.lang.String routerURL, int appId, java.lang.String appKey)
      The RightsManager class connects to a NexLabs Rights Management Server using the appId and the appKey.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RightsManager

        public RightsManager(java.lang.String routerURL,
                     int appId,
                     java.lang.String appKey)
              throws com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException
        The RightsManager class connects to a NexLabs Rights Management Server using the appId and the appKey. Refer to the user guide on how to generate an appId and appKey in Rights Management Server.
        Parameters:
        routerURL - URL of the Rights Management Router
        appId - Rights Management Application ID
        appKey - Rights Management Application Key
        Throws:
        com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException - if appId or appKey or routerURL is missing

    • Method Detail

      • encrypt

        public void encrypt(java.lang.String inputPath,
                    java.lang.String outputPath,
                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> attributes,
                    com.nextlabs.nxl.Rights[] rights,
                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> tags,
                    java.lang.String parentTenantName,
                    java.lang.String projectName)
             throws com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException
        This method can be used to encrypt files and convert them to NXL format.
        Parameters:
        inputPath - The path of the input file to be encrypted.
        outputPath - The path where the encrypted NXL file is written.
        attributes - Attributes to be added to the NXL file.
        rights - Rights to be added to the NXL file.
        tags - Tags to be added to the NXL file.
        parentTenantName - Name of the tenant project is created under. Default tenant will be used if NULL is provided.
        projectName - Name of project whose tokens are to be used to encrypt input file
        Throws:
        com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException - if there is an IOException or a NXL specific exception

                          java.lang.String parentTenantName,
                          java.lang.String projectName)
                   throws com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException
        This method can be used to encrypt an input stream to an encrypted output stream.
        Parameters:
        in - Stream to be encrypted.
        out - Stream to write the encrypted content to.
        fileName - File name of the input stream (stored as part of the NXL metadata)
        contentLength - Length of the input stream
        attributes - Attributes to be added to the NXL file.
        rights - Rights to be added to the NXL file.

      • buildNxlHeader

        public com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlFile buildNxlHeader(byte[] header)
                                        throws com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException
        Build a NXL header which can be reused for future partial decryptions. This method returns only the nxl header.
        Parameters:
        header - Starting bytes of the NXL file. Must be at least of a standard NXL header length which can be obtained from getHeaderSize()
        Returns:
        NxlFile header
        Throws:
        com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException - if there is an IOException or a NXL specific exception
        See Also:
        decryptPartial(java.io.InputStream, java.io.OutputStream, com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlFile, long, long), getHeaderSize()

      • buildNxlHeader

        public com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlFile buildNxlHeader(byte[] header,
                                               java.lang.String parentTenantName,
                                               java.lang.String projectName)
                                        throws com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException
        Build a NXL header which can be reused for future partial decryptions. This method returns only the nxl header.
        Parameters:
        header - Starting bytes of the NXL file. Must be at least of a standard NXL header length which can be obtained from getHeaderSize()
        parentTenantName - Name of the parent tenant. Default tenant will be used if NULL is provided.
        projectName - Name of the project.
        Returns:
        NxlFile header
        Throws:
        com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException - if there is an IOException or a NXL specific exception
        See Also:
        decryptPartial(java.io.InputStream, java.io.OutputStream, com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlFile, long, long), getHeaderSize()

      • buildNxlHeader

        public com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlFile buildNxlHeader(byte[] header,
                                               java.lang.String tenantName,
                                               com.nextlabs.common.shared.Constants.TokenGroupType tgType)
                                        throws com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException
        Build a NXL header which can be reused for future partial decryptions. This method returns only the nxl header.
        Parameters:
        header - Starting bytes of the NXL file. Must be at least of a standard NXL header length which can be obtained from getHeaderSize()
        tenantName - Name of the tenant. Default tenant will be used if NULL is provided.
        tgType - TokenGroupType - TOKENGROUP_TENANT or TOKENGROUP_SYSTEMBUCKET
        Returns:
        NxlFile header
        Throws:
        com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException - if there is an IOException or a NXL specific exception
        See Also:
        decryptPartial(java.io.InputStream, java.io.OutputStream, com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlFile, long, long), getHeaderSize()

      • decryptPartial

        public void decryptPartial(java.io.InputStream in,
                           java.io.OutputStream out,
                           com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlFile header,
                           long start,
                           long len)
                    throws com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException
        This method decrypts an input stream starting from start for len bytes and write it to an output stream. If token caching is enabled then please note that at present, the entry eviction/cleanup by Google Guava cache is implemented as "small amounts of maintenance during write operations [on the cache, not during file I/O], or during occasional read operations if writes are rare".
        Parameters:
        in - Stream to be decrypted.
        out - Stream to write the encrypted content to.
        header - NXL header constructed from buildNxlHeader() which must be valid and non-null
        start - Position to start decryption from
        len - Number of bytes to decrypt
        Throws:
        com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException - if there is an IOException or a NXL specific exception
        See Also:
        buildNxlHeader(java.lang.String)

      • decryptPartial

        public void decryptPartial(java.io.InputStream in,
                           java.io.OutputStream out,
                           com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlFile header,
                           long start,
                           long len,
                           java.lang.String parentTenantName,
                           java.lang.String projectName)
                    throws com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException
        This method decrypts an input stream starting from start for len bytes and write it to an output stream. If token caching is enabled then please note that at present, the entry eviction/cleanup by Google Guava cache is implemented as "small amounts of maintenance during write operations [on the cache, not during file I/O], or during occasional read operations if writes are rare".
        Parameters:
        in - Stream to be decrypted.
        out - Stream to write the encrypted content to.
        header - NXL header constructed from buildNxlHeader(), but if its null then the method will parse it automatically so the inputstream need not "skip" those bytes
        start - Position to start decryption from
        len - Number of bytes to decrypt
        parentTenantName - Name of the tenant project is created under. Default tenant will be used if NULL is provided.
        projectName - Name of project whose tokens are to be used to decrypt input stream
        Throws:
        com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException - if there is an IOException or a NXL specific exception
        See Also:
        buildNxlHeader(java.lang.String)

      • decryptPartial

        public void decryptPartial(java.io.InputStream in,
                           java.io.OutputStream out,
                           com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlFile header,
                           long start,
                           long len,
                           java.lang.String tenantName,
                           com.nextlabs.common.shared.Constants.TokenGroupType tgType)
                    throws com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException
        This method decrypts an input stream starting from start for len bytes and write it to an output stream If token caching is enabled then please note that at present, the entry eviction/cleanup by Google Guava cache is implemented as "small amounts of maintenance during write operations [on the cache, not during file I/O], or during occasional read operations if writes are rare".
        Parameters:
        in - Stream to be decrypted.
        out - Stream to write the encrypted content to.
        header - NXL header constructed from buildNxlHeader(), but if its null then the method will parse it automatically so the inputstream need not "skip" those bytes
        start - Position to start decryption from
        len - Number of bytes to decrypt
        tenantName - Name of the tenant whose tokens are to be used to decrypt input stream. Default tenant will be used if NULL is provided.
        tgType - TokenGroupType - TOKENGROUP_TENANT or TOKENGROUP_SYSTEMBUCKET
        Throws:
        com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException - if there is an IOException or a NXL specific exception
        See Also:
        buildNxlHeader(java.lang.String)

      • flushTokenFromCache

        public boolean flushTokenFromCache(java.lang.String duid)
        This method can be called to invalidate the token in cache if it were present (and caching were enabled, otherwise does not apply) for a given duid, otherwise it returns false immediately.
        Parameters:
        duid - The duid of the NXL file which is available in the NxlFile object (returned by buildNxlHeader) by calling header.getDuid()
        Returns:
        true if token caching was enabled and token for given duid was submitted for invalidation. The actual eviction might happen when the maintenance operation will be performed by Google Guava cache.

      • getOriginalContentLength

        public long getOriginalContentLength(com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlFile header)
        This method returns the length of the file before encryption.
        Parameters:
        header - NxlFile header
        Returns:
        length of the original file
        See Also:
        buildNxlHeader(java.lang.String)

      • updateTags

        public void updateTags(java.lang.String inputPath,
                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> tags,
                       java.lang.String tenantName,
                       com.nextlabs.common.shared.Constants.TokenGroupType tgType,
                       java.lang.String projectName)
                throws com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException
        This method updates the tags in the NXL header with the new values.
        Parameters:
        inputPath - The path of the input file to update.
        tags - Tags to be added to the NXL file.
        tenantName - Name of the tenant. Default tenant will be used if NULL is provided.
        tgType - token group type - TOKENGROUP_TENANT/TOKENGROUP_PROJECT/TOKENGROUP_SYSTEMBUCKET
        projectName - project name if tgType is TOKENGROUP_PROJECT
        Throws:
        com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException - if there is an IOException or a NXL specific exception

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        This method checks whether a file is a valid NXL file or not.
        Parameters:
        is - InputStream object of the input file to validate.
        Returns:
        true for valid NXL files, false for non-NXL files or if an Exception occurs.

      • getProjectMetadata

        public com.nextlabs.common.shared.JsonProject getProjectMetadata(java.lang.Integer projectId,
                                                                 java.lang.String projectName,
                                                                 java.lang.String parentTenant)
                                                          throws com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException
        This method is used to get project metadata.
        Parameters:
        projectId - id of project.
        projectName - Name of project, projectId will be omitted if projectName is present.
        parentTenant - The tenant under which the project is created. Default tenant will be used if NULL is provided.
        Returns:
        project metadata if project exists, null if project doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException - if there is an IOException or a NXL specific exception

      • getClassification

                                                                     throws com.nextlabs.nxl.NxlException
